search_results.title: Summertime Mama
search_results.lyrics:
Summertime Mama Lyrics[Verse]
Way down in New Orleans
That pretty songbird sure can sing
I wish I wasn't a gambling man
I wish I had a little more sense than that
Sing me till the sun comes up
Blind me with that nighttime dust

[Bridge]
Now I'm halfway round again
Now I'm halfway round again
[Chorus]
Summertime mama breaking me down
Wearing that dress, girl, I've seen you around
Summertime mama throwing me around
Hot like the stones on the Tennessee ground

[Verse]
Cover me like a storm cloud does
In the afternoon when you're caught off-guard
Never knew that I noticed you
Till I felt that lightning inside my arm
Turn me over, turn me up
Turn me on like a boiling pot

[Bridge]
Now I'm halfway round again
Now I'm halfway round again

[Chorus]
Summertime mama breaking me down
Wearing that dress, girl, I've seen you around
Summertime mama throwing me around
Hot like the stones on the Tennessee ground

[Outro]
Way down in New Orleans
That pretty songbird sure can singYou might also likeEmbed

album.full_title: The Greatest Part by Becca Mancari
album.name: The Greatest Part

annotations:
Letters in the mailbox say I’m gonna hunt you down
 I’m gonna hunt you down
 I am the prophet, I am the savior
 Well I am the prophet, I am the savior

There are several examples of threatening mail one could receive, such as ransom notes or hate mail. However, Mancari seems to not be referring to literal threatening letters, but rather something with a religious tone.

Perhaps the most infamous of all proselytizers are Jehovah’s Witnesses, who often leave pamphlets for those they miss while going door-to-door. As Mancari alludes, their message of “sorry we missed you” seems more like a “we’ll get you next time”. While their persistence is an annoyance for many, this would be especially threatening to Mancari, considering her queerness and the Witnesses' anti-gay views.

search_results.title: First Time
search_results.lyrics:
First Time Lyrics[Verse 1]
I remember the first time my dad didn't hug me back
Under porch lights with my sister's old cigarettes
With your hands hanging to your side and my face to your chest

[Refrain]
They say the heart grows stronger
But man, it's hard to get back on track

[Verse 2]
I remember the first time I tried to tell you the truth
On a Sunday drive with my heart stuck in my chest
Would the God you love take that love so easily back?
[Pre-Chorus]
They say the heart grows stronger
But man it's hard to get back on track
They say the heart grows stronger
But man it's hard to get back on track

[Chorus]
Hey, did you find your way out?
Hey, did you find your way out?
Hey, did you find your way out?
Hey, did you find your way out?

[Instrumental Break]

[Chorus]
Hey, did you find your way out?
Hey, did you find your way out?
Hey, did you find your way out?
Hey, did you find your way out?

[Outro]
I remember the first time my dad didn't hug me backYou might also likeEmbed

annotations: I remember the first time my dad didn’t hug me back
Emma has said this song is about her coming out.

Hey, did you find your way out?
 Hey, did you find your way out?
 Hey, did you find your way out?
 Hey, did you find your way out?
Emma has stated that this is her asking her younger self – Hey, did you find your way out?

I heard music in an old country home
